summary: The Work Zone Weather Integration Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of Transportation, in collaboration with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, to establish a pilot program. This program aims to improve roadway safety by integrating real-time weather hazard alerts with active work zone data. The program will develop technical protocols, deploy integrated alert systems in participating states, and assess the feasibility of nationwide deployment. The Secretary must solicit participation from at least five states, and a report on the pilot program's activities, lessons learned, and recommendations is due within three years of enactment.
